sub_title: Director of Research and Operations at DVJ Insights
summary: I am a seasoned operations professional, who grows and leads teams to success. I am an empathetic leader. In my roles I manage the day-to-day operations of my teams, including time sensitive and difficult projects, resource allocation, performance management, process improvement, and supervise and direct staff. I unify team dynamics, while also addressing the special and diverse needs of individual team members. Above all, I organize team work flow, policies and procedures, while managing individual interests and strategic goals.

profile_positions.description:
•	Set up Research Operations for a UXR team that has grown from 5 to 15 researchers, located in Amsterdam, Berlin, and Enschede.
•	Democratized research by setting up tools and a program to train designers and product owners
•	Consult with researchers on how best to set-up projects, define gaps in service, and connect resources and topics across verticals.
•	Guided the UXR team to GDPR compliance and serve as the team GDPR compliance ambassador.
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Operations Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Directly manage user research projects for a team of 35 UX Researchers studying how users interact with Booking Experiences and Marketing.
•	Developed a Research Brief template for use by the entire Research Department of 38 researchers to standardize the process and create more consistent output.
•	Manage the process of identifying and working with Recruitment Agencies for complex international research projects.
•	Collaborated with the Data Compliance Department to create Research Guidelines for working with PII.
profile_positions.title: Research Operations Specialist

profile_positions.description:
•	Chief of Staff for 35 team members at the Schroeder Institute for Tobacco Research and Policy Studies at Truth Initiative.
•	Responsible for senior level operations and administrative oversight for research activities throughout the Schroeder Institute. 
•	Directly supervise and mentor the Administrative Coordinator and Communications Associate.
•	Provided direct oversight and reported on the $6 million fiscal year budget. 
•	Managed and reported on 23 externally government, university, and privately funded grants and subcontracts.
•	Identified personnel needs and managed all aspects of the hiring and on-boarding process for the Schroeder Institute staff, fellows, and interns.
•	Oversaw, developed and disseminated annual reports, newsletters, and other internal and external communication.
•	Managed staff compliance and coordinated training for research-relevant policies and procedures, including human subjects training, conflict of interest, confidentiality and protection of confidential data.
profile_positions.title: Senior Administrator

profile_positions.description:
•	Managed the administrative and operations functions of the Science and Strategy team, directly supporting the Chief Scientist, team Director and five junior staff.
•	Directly supervised and managed the Project Coordinator. 
•	Managed large donor grants, developed reports and monitored milestones and deliverables.
•	Managed all aspects of the hiring and on-boarding process for the Science and Strategy department staff, fellows, and interns.
•	Drafted correspondence, briefings, meeting memos, departmental reports and presentations for the Chief Scientist.
•	Strategized team operations and dynamics and recommended and implemented policy solutions.
•	Worked with international offices to advize on planning, logistics, contracting, communications, science, development, and international activities.  
•	Managed strategic planning efforts and development of Board documents.
•	Liaised with all Oceana teams to effectively run the department.
profile_positions.title: Administrative Manager, Science and Strategy

profile_positions.description:
Associate (2013-2015)
•	Managed department operations for the Senior Director and a staff of 40 team members.
•	Monitored and evaluated the project-development process.
Developed unit Pew compliant policies and procedures.
•	Worked closely with the Senior Director to monitor and develop the fiscal year budget.
•	Prepared, edited and shepherded contracts, grants and project funding agreements.
•	Managed and monitored reporting payment schedules.
•	Coordinated strategic planning efforts, developing annual program plans and other Board documents.
•	Developed, wrote and edited memos for internal audiences and presentations for public forums.
•	Assisted in the conception, development and smooth implementation of project forums and gatherings.  
•	Liaised with Legal Affairs to properly vet gatherings and monitor staff lobbying efforts. 

Administrative Assistant (2010-2013)
•	Directly supported three senior executives, managing calendars, coordinating all travel arrangements, organizing daily agenda materials, and tracking items for review.  Concurrently supported 40 research staff.
•	Tracked budgets, processed expense reimbursements and invoices, ensuring proper coding and liaised with finance staff to make timely payments.
•	Managed final draft quality control, coordinating the secondary review and external fact checking processes for 50 publications, annually.
•	Managed and edited contracts: drafted scopes of work, interfaced with vendors, and ensured guidelines were followed and deadlines met.
•	Contributed to the overall execution of special projects including policy forums, webinars and other convenings.
•	Trained and assisted research staff with PowerPoint presentation development and design, including those used before state and local policy makers.
profile_positions.title: Associate and Administrative Assistant

profile_positions.description:
•	Main point of contact for over 500 clients, ensuring satisfaction with follow-up customer service emails and phone calls.  
•	Handled all logistics and coordinated approximately 10-11 trainings per week for clients.
•	Interviewed, hired, trained, and managed all interns.
•	Designed and developed all corporate training materials.   
•	Customized client trainings to specific needs through extensive research, on tight deadlines.
•	Worked with the CEO on special projects.  
•	Managed, instructed and scheduled all contract camera operators.
profile_positions.title: Training and Intern Manager

profile_positions.description:
Audio Engineer (2004-2007)
•	Mixed audio sources using the Wheatstone D9 audio console.
•	Maintained equipment: lavaliere wireless and hard wired microphones and satellite feeds.  
•	Edited various handpicked current music beds and other show themed cuts.
•	Cleared live shots and provided suitable IFB levels to ensure proper audio levels. 

Robotic Camera Engineer (2002-2005)		         	   
•	Worked creatively with the Senior Director/TD and producers on blocking and production of shows, including regular newscasts and pre-produced programming. 
•	Responsible for the final output of eight cameras, including remote cameras and TSM Robotics cameras. 
•	Pre-taped creative programming.
•	Worked with talent, producers, directors and guests to provide an on-camera aesthetic.   
•	Responsible for target system cleaning, shot file maintenance, and white balancing and color correction using a “chip chart” for maintenance
profile_positions.title: Audio and Robotoic Camera Engineer
